instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 SMC_RESET_L signal at 0V
threads.message: good day guys , this board is making me go crazy, SMC_RESET is 0V , but when I remove R5110 it goes high , when I put it back its low, I replaced it, but no difference , I tried with the SMC as well as R7100 to rule out a faulty U7100, and even R5100 replaced , all with no changes , please where do I go from here ? also the jtag is already removed even though was Spotless

threads.title: 820-00165 SMC_RESET_L signal at 0V
threads.message: probably pulled down by the SMC then..

threads.title: 820-00165 SMC_RESET_L signal at 0V
threads.message:
Post all voltages for U5110.
Change C5101.
Don't forget to disconnect trackpad flex.
If still the same, remove U5110 and check if SMC_RESET_L goes high.

threads.title: 820-00165 SMC_RESET_L signal at 0V
threads.message:
[QUOTE="captainmac, post: 66058, member: 1423"]
probably pulled down by the SMC then..
[/QUOTE]
have replaced 3 functional SMC, with U5110 removed it goes high

threads.title: 820-00165 SMC_RESET_L signal at 0V
threads.message:
I have replaced C5101 but no changes , with U5110 removed  SMC_RESET_L is high 
 below are the readings of U5110

U5110

PIN 1. 3.40V

PIN 2.GND

PIN 3.0V

PIN 4.0V

PIN 5. 0V

PIN 6.3V

PIN 7.3.3V

PIN 8. 1.1 and drops gradually

threads.title: 820-00165 SMC_RESET_L signal at 0V
threads.message: Change R5127 first; VIN is required...

threads.title: 820-00165 SMC_RESET_L signal at 0V
threads.message: my bad , R5127 voltage is resent and pin 3 is 3.3V

threads.title: 820-00165 SMC_RESET_L signal at 0V
threads.message:
Thank you , the post can be closed .
The issue was as you pointed out at R5127, even though 3.3V was present in and out , there was a break between the resistor and pin 3 of U5110, I recreated the break and the board worked okay . Thank you so much
